content: Ok, I have no quick solution, but I infer there was just an update to Thunderbird? If true, then the update may have lost your profile. My suggestion to pursue that would be to click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles'. That takes you to a pane showing available profiles. One of them may be your profile prior to the upgrade.
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest not inserting password. The configuration can complete without it and you will be prompted later for password. My guess is that may be the only issue, as everything else looks proper. If that goes correctly, the next issue will be to find the password. Some email providers now require separate password when used on an email client. Examples include Gmail, Verizon, AOL, AT&T and possibly others, so that may be true for Mailfence. But I don't know.

content:
Yes, it seems the option can't be switched on or off. On my setup, it appears to be locked to 'off', i.e. both images and text are zoomed. I can't find a setting in Config. editor that controls it. Maybe running once in troubleshoot mode will change your setting (Help/Troubleshoot Mode). Sometimes this has the effect of resetting things that don't offer an obvious switch.

In TB 102, the check mark can be turned on or off, but it has no effect.
creator: sfhowes

content: I may be misunderstanding your concern, but I think clicking 'unified folders' will accomplish much of what you want. That is set at the icon to the right of the 'new message' button. With unified folders, you can have just the inbox showing when that is all you want to see. If the message list pane shows the messages sorted to show newest at bottom, you can change that in table view' at the icon to the right of 'quick filter'
creator: davidsk

content: Right-click a folder in the Folder Pane and set it as a Favourite Folder, then View/Folders/Favourite Folders. Click the 3-dot icon to move Favourite Folders up or down.

content: Several people have posted that concern. However, this is a support site staffed by volunteers. None of us have the authority to change any component. If you wish to communicate that higher up, you could post your concern at connect.mozilla.org. Thank you..

creator: sfhowes

content: OK, found the problem. Since Thunderbird had changed, Bitdefender had disallowed the newly installed software to function. I had searched the Bitdefender logs, to see if anything had happened, and I found the line denying Thunderbird internet access, due to the software change. I enabled Thunderbird to access the network, and all was well.

content: Select Table View from the icon next to the Quick Filter button, then enable the From column by right-clicking any current column. From will then be available in the Sort by menu.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Go to this link https://outlook.live.com/mail/0/options/mail/accounts

The page will display your personal account settings for accessing IMAP, POP and SMTP. The settings will probably be the same as all other free users, but it is a good way to verify what Thunderbird is getting.

Note that setting up a Thunderbird account will probably require you to use the authentication method oauth2.0
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
So move them back. Click on the first message in the list, hold the shift key and click the last in the list you want (multiple selection of list items has worked that way since at least windows version 3 in 1985, and it appears apple agree that is the multiple list selection method. https://support.apple.com/en-au/guide/mac-help/mchlp1378/mac)


Now drag the messages where you want them.

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
There is a reason I bought a large SSD drive and an even larger spinning platter drive for my computer. I have no intentions of being stuck using Microsoft because they have all my files. Or paying them for extra storage for their backup decisions.

Fundamentally desktop applications are from an era where file contention was not something the developer had to even consider. Cloud syncing makes is a minute by minute nonoccurence and is developing ever more issues with incomplete and partial copies of things. I will not be joining it.

It is good to see a solution to this issue at least in your instance.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
This is to follow up on the issue of OneDrive getting "stuck" on files and having to reboot the computer in order to be able to attach a file in TB. I have researched this and now have talked with MS Tech Support and there is no way at all to have OneDrive backup the computer if it doesn't also sync.

The only way to fix OneDrive-created issues is to uninstall OneDrive entirely. Once done, all Word and other MS app functions will write only to your own computer, and that is the only way to avoid having OneDrive interfering with your workflow. So I am doing that.

I appreciate TB support helping me work through this issue.
creator: Victoria-nola

content:
First and foremost, many many folk have issues with account configuration because of antivirus programs. The either block everything, or just the validation part.

Is your email with a well recognized provider, or is it hosted? For example one of the large hosting providers insists on using Microsoft exchange, so an add-on is required to configure the exchange proprietary protocols.

content: Verizon and AOL require an APP password when using email clients on a PC. I believe you must go to the AOL site and select the security page and can set up the APP password there. See this page for more info: https://help.aol.com/articles/Create-and-manage-app-password
creator: davidsk

content:
According to the documentation you referenced, an APP password is only needed if you have enabled 2 step verification. I have not. My AOL password works on other devices. I think the problem has more to do with the configuration Thunderbird is giving me. Using my desired email address as example@verizon.net , Thunderbird is using the following: Incoming POP3 SSL/TLS 

  pop.verizon.net

Outgoing SMPT SSL/TLS 

  smpt.verizon.net

Username 

  example

I believe when AOL took over the Verizon emails, the POP server became pop.aol.com and the SMPT server became smpt.aol.com Also, I've seen posts that say the username should be example@verizon.net Instead of just example. I've tried all the above combinations and none has worked. Thanks for your help.
creator: wmattiace

content: Try pop.aol.com and smtp.pop.com (I have verizon account - imap - and it uses imap.aol.com and smtp.aol.com. ) Yes, use full email address.

content:
Tried with the following configuration:

Incoming Server 

    Protocol  POP3     Hostname   pop.aol.com     Port  995     Connection Security     SSL/TLS     Authentication Method   Normal Password     Username   example@verizon.net

Outgoing Server 

    Hostname   smpt.aol.com     Port   465     Connection Security    SSL/TLS     Authentication Method   Normal Password     Username   example@verizon.net

Error message: Unable to log into server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password. Thanks.

content: THis thread may help, indicating that OAUTH2 may be your solution: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1360869
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks, David.

Solution was to change the Authentication Method for the Incoming Server to OAUTH2 instead of normal password. TB then went to the AOL site and allowed me to OK TB getting mail from AOL. This was not very intuitive, and I thank you for your help.
creator: wmattiace
